Martin Riggs.Action: Advances drunkenly toward suspicious men despite apparent mental and physical impairment.
Pretends to be drunk and disoriented, looking for a lost dog to deceive the South Africans.
Shows concern for a lost dog, calling it a 'good dog.'
Suddenly becomes alert and authoritative, wielding a gun and taking control of a dangerous situation.
Feigns drunkenness to deceive opponents and gain a tactical advantage.
Quickly recovers from acting drunk to draw his weapon with deadly precision.
Immediately runs after the Gulfstream without waiting for partner's reply.
Swings out from beneath the airplane with agility and surprise, immediately firing his weapon effectively at the Pilot.
Rolls out of the way of the landing gear with quick reflexes, avoiding serious injury.
Determines which vehicle to pursue quickly and directs Murtaugh without hesitation.
Takes a tumble when the staircase tears away but recovers quickly and continues pursuit.
Runs after a moving Gulfstream jet on foot, leaps onto the wing, works his way toward the opening in the fuselage, and pulls himself into the plane despite losing his gun.
His foot slips while trying to swing into the doorway of the moving plane and he almost falls, losing his Beretta in the process.
Engages in a brutal hand-to-hand fight with Hans, demonstrating equal skill and endurance in martial arts.
Stops the plane to prevent it from going over a cliff, risking his own life.
Holds Hans' suitcase after the crash and faces the crowd calmly.
Responds defensively and somewhat aggressively to Murtaugh's questions.
Pulls back hard on the brake levers to stop the plane just before a deadly cliff, preventing certain death for himself and Hans.

Focuses on having stopped the plane and secured a suitcase full of money as an accomplishment despite chaos and possible casualties, showing some disregard for broader consequences.
Captured a plane and a suitcase full of money before lunch despite difficulties.
